availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Reuben Rogers (Bath County, Kentucky, pvt Bath Co Rangers & !st Reg Cap Guards)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Rogers and Eliza A. Rogers. Married to Rebecca Stewart Rogers in Bath County on October 24, 1854. Father of Othilla Rogers, Spencer Rogers, and Martha Rogers. Student in Bath County in 1850. Served in Captain Busseyâ€™s Bath County Rangers as a private from December 11, 1863, to April 1, 1864. Served in the First Regiment Capital Guards, Frankfort Battalion, as a private from February 1, 1864, to January 12, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 76A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Bethel, p. 19A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film #000273007, p. 14 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 762, 888.
Special Schedules of the Eleventh Census (1890) Enumerating Union Veterans and Widows of Union Veterans of the Civil War, Series M123, NARA RG 15, Records of the Department of Veterans Affairs, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 1 of 4.
